Temperatures are projected to rise between 4 and 10 degrees by the end of the 21st century. \nCommon concerns with rising global temperatures include sea level rise, increased frequency in extreme weather events, and displacement of groups living near the equator.

Decreased air quality introduces a number of health risks and concerns. Ground-level ozone (a key component of smog) is associated with many health problems.
